extends java.lang.Object
implements WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public int check(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                 int start,
                 int end)
        Description copied from interface: WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Checks if given sub-sequence of the given text contains symbols that may be treated as white spaces.
        Specified by:
        check in interface WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Parameters:
        text - text to check
        start - start offset to use with the given text (inclusive)
        end - end offset to use with the given text (exclusive)
        Returns:
        offset of the first symbol that belongs to [startOffset; endOffset) range and is not treated as white space by the current strategy or value that is greater or equal to the given 'end' parameter if all target sub-sequence symbols can be treated as white spaces

      • containsWhitespacesOnly

        public boolean containsWhitespacesOnly(ASTNode node)
        Description copied from interface: WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Allows to answer if given node should be treated as white space node.
        Specified by:
        containsWhitespacesOnly in interface WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Parameters:
        node - node to check
        Returns:
        true if given node should be treated as white space; false otherwise

      • replaceDefaultStrategy

        public boolean replaceDefaultStrategy()
        Specified by:
        replaceDefaultStrategy in interface WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Returns:
        true if default white space strategy used by formatter should be replaced by the current one; false to indicate that current strategy should be used in composition with default strategy if any, i.e. particular symbols sequence should be considered as white spaces if any of composed strategies defines so

      • adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary

        public java.lang.CharSequence adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary(java.lang.CharSequence whiteSpaceText,
                                                          java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                                          int startOffset,
                                                          int endOffset,
                                                          CodeStyleSettings codeStyleSettings,
                                                          ASTNode nodeAfter)
        Description copied from interface: WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Main formatter's duty is to tweak white space symbols (add/remove/modify them). However, it may be necessary to pay special attention to that. For example it may be necessary to ensure that '\' symbol is used inside multiline expression in case of Python etc.

        This method defines a callback that allows to modify white space symbols to use for replacing particular document symbols sub-sequence if necessary.

        Specified by:
        adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary in interface WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Parameters:
        whiteSpaceText - white space text to use by default for replacing sub-sequence of the given text
        text - target text which region is to be replaced by the given white space symbols
        startOffset - start offset to use with the given text (inclusive)
        endOffset - end offset to use with the given text (exclusive)
        codeStyleSettings - the code style settings
        nodeAfter - the AST node following the whitespace, if known
        Returns:
        symbols to use for replacing [startOffset; endOffset) sub-sequence of the given text

      • adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary

        public java.lang.CharSequence adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary(java.lang.CharSequence whiteSpaceText,
                                                          PsiElement startElement,
                                                          int startOffset,
                                                          int endOffset,
                                                          CodeStyleSettings codeStyleSettings)
        Description copied from interface: WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        PSI-based version of WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy.adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary(CharSequence, CharSequence, int, int, com.intellij.psi.codeStyle.CodeStyleSettings, com.intellij.lang.ASTNode).

        There is a possible case that particular changes are performed to PSI tree and it's not yet synchronized with the underlying document. Hence, we can't directly work with document char sequence but need to traverse PSI tree instead. I.e. we start with particular PSI element that contains given start offset and process its right siblings/relatives until given end offset is reached.

        Specified by:
        adjustWhiteSpaceIfNecessary in interface WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Parameters:
        whiteSpaceText - white space text to use by default for replacing sub-sequence of the given text
        startElement - PSI element that contains given start offset
        startOffset - start offset to use with the given text (inclusive)
        endOffset - end offset to use with the given text (exclusive)
        codeStyleSettings - the code style settings
        Returns:
        symbols to use for replacing [startOffset; endOffset) sub-sequence of the given text

      • addWhitespace

        public boolean addWhitespace(ASTNode treePrev,
                             LeafElement whiteSpaceElement)
        Description copied from interface: WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Allows to customize addition of the given white space element to the AST referenced by the given node.
        Specified by:
        addWhitespace in interface WhiteSpaceFormattingStrategy
        Parameters:
        treePrev - target node to use as an anchor for inserting given white space element
        whiteSpaceElement - target white space element to insert
        Returns:
        true if given white space element was added in a custom way during the current method call processing; false as an indicator that given white space element has not been inserted during the current method call
